intro: Streptanthus insignis subsp. insignis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This subspecies is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
